website_summaries.verdict: Helping Munch to save the future of his species is a goofy, tense, and absolute brain-teaser of a platforming adventure that will keep you on your toes until the very end.
pros: Actively switch between Abe and Munch to complete levels
cons: Visuals may seem dated for some players

customer_reviews.title: Great Game!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great game. I've played the oddworld games on the playstation, and I like the pc version better. The graphics are much better at a higher resolution setting, and the characters grow on you... Like a fungus. I bought a logitech wireless pc controller just for this game, and it was well worth it because trying to play this on your keyboard is pretty frustrating. I just got through finishing it all the way to the end, and now I started from the beginning so I can rescue more fuzzles. I told you it was addictive. I highly recommned it!
customer_reviews.author: Afobos

customer_reviews.title: I remember playing this game as kid and I love it now just as much as I did before
customer_reviews.text: I remember playing this game as kid and I love it now just as much as I did before. However... they really need to make it more computer friendly. The controls are way to hard.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Game!
customer_reviews.text: I remember playing this game when I was younger, and I was so happy to find it online for the PC! Back then I was stuck playing it on the Xbox, which had sound issues. By far my favorite game from a wonderful series. Keep it up, Oddworld Inhabitants!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Brown

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic and Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy to engage in Oddworld's first Xbox title! Although the graphics are not as cleaned up as recent versions available on the app store, this game held up with its humor, grittiness, and criticism on society. I recommend everyone to give this game a go!
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry Marcy

customer_reviews.title: Good, but navigation is a bit clunky.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this game and it was inexpensive, but the navigation and "camera" controls are a bit clunky and take some time to get used to. This is expecially true when you need to navigate/jump carefully around some sections. Because of the inferior controls, I would select something else.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: id say if u want ur childhood again youtube it i tried beating it with the no save just cudnt its like a long game
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt let u save game so...id say if u want ur childhood again youtube it i tried beating it with the no save just cudnt its like a long game
customer_reviews.author: Jinzo96

customer_reviews.title: Becareful
customer_reviews.text: Just make sure you have a controller for your PC
customer_reviews.author: curley

customer_reviews.title: should be really 4 1/2 stars! :)
customer_reviews.text: it is a REALLY good game, but there is a few glitches with the game. when u get to some levels it tells you that it saves the game but really it doesnt. :( but over it is a really good game and i think that it should be for ages 12- teens.
customer_reviews.author: DRM

customer_reviews.title: BAD EXPERIENCE
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to download this for my Grandson to play on our PC and I could NEVER get it to download....>May have been "user error" but I wouldn't think it would be any more difficult than all the other downloads I have gotten......Just Disappointed that I paid for it and never got it !
customer_reviews.author: Susie Belser

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: The only real drawback is that it won't support gravis or logitech gamepads. Game has to have an X-Box style controller if you want to play with a game pad. Otherwise it's a good addition to the Oddworld Series. Trouble free game play running on Windows 8 64 bit Makes me think of the movie Critters at times.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: No match
customer_reviews.text: This game just isn't a match for Abe's Oddysee. It's a shame that doesn't play on any recent machine. Oh well, this will have to do.
customer_reviews.author: princewally

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful 3D graphics, controls don't work.
customer_reviews.text: I had problems playing this game, because the controls didn't work. Windows Vista, 128 MB video card. The game controller was missing some of the important functions, and the arrow keys on the keyboard couldn't even navigate the menus!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fav Game
customer_reviews.text: I love this game I was on a hunt to find it because who owns a xbox anymore really. .
customer_reviews.author: Emily Spidale

customer_reviews.title: Boring
customer_reviews.text: I've played exodus and this one is pretty boring and dumb compared to its former game. I should have purchased exodus instead.
customer_reviews.author: Xaero

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Game just doe not play well on Windows 8. Controls are hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sara B

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Recommend for PC..
customer_reviews.text: It runs on the PC terribly... I will not recommend it to anyone. Using keyboard is fruitless waste of time with the program.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.Fragassi

customer_reviews.title: Oddworld: Munch's Oddysee [Download)
customer_reviews.text: good game,for the price! but some troubles with windows 7(no gamepad) and it doesn''t work with windows 8!No update possible
customer_reviews.author: herve duhamel

customer_reviews.title: Well?
customer_reviews.text: I have a fast computer but this game took a long time to download. The game worked fine the first time I played it. The second time I went to play, I could play the game but wasn't able to scroll through the options on the menu screen to save or do anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Malomi

product_meta.title: Oddworld: Munch's Oddysee [Download]
product_meta.description:
Platform:PC DownloadFROM THE MANUFACTURER


 

Players guide Mudokon champion Abe, and his aquatic Gabbit partner Munch, in Oddworld's third adventure, using special psychic powers, cool power-ups, and other special abilities to deliver payback as they reclaim the last gabbit eggs on Oddworld, which have been packaged in a can of gabbiar.



Power-Ups - Every friendly character you can find becomes a fighting ally, Fuzzles, Mudokons... Need to get somewhere quickly or get over a wall, like right now? Use Oddworld's consumer power-ups like Expresso and Bounce to amp up Munch and Abe's abilities to perform cool moves. For the more direct approach, possess high-caliber weapon toting enemies. Oddworld, now in "new and improved 3D!" - it's a whole new Oddworld, with lush rivers, towering mountains and hundreds of trees that bloom or die. Interact with dozens of different oddball races - use GameSpeak to get Oddworld's Inhabitants from the heavily armed Big Bro Sligs to the cute but ferocious Fuzzles to carry out tricky tasks or just beat the crap out of enemies. Frustration Free gaming - Oddworld's new intelligent cinematic camera, auto-targeting system and no-stick navigation system makes playing a breeze! Plus with easy QuikSave and limitless lives, players have plenty of chances to take on any situation... no matter how Odd! 
SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
Minimum Specifications: OS:Win 7, Vista and XP Processor:Intel Core2 + RAM:1GB Hard Drive:3.8GB Video Card:nVidia 6600+ Additional Info:Unknown

JV5.0 out of 5 stars A great game at a great price.Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2015Platform: PC DownloadVerified Purchase I used to play this game with my sister on her Xbox all the time before she moved to England. Now I get to play it whenever I want on my PC. Please note that if you have Avast Antivirus, you'll need to disable it before you attempt to download this game; otherwise, the contents of the folder that the downloader, erm... downloads to your desktop will be deleted. My installation of Avast kept detecting munch.exe, a necessary executable file for the game to run, as malware. It's just a false positive; munch.exe is harmless. You can probably re-enable Avast once you finish installing the game, but it'll still detect munch.exe and move it to quarantine. If you can, report the file as a false positive when that little pop-up message shows up on the bottom right hand corner of your screen. You'll need information like the name of the file, its publisher, etc. If you want to just play the game, go to the quarantine list in Avast, find the file, right-click on it, select "restore and add to exclusions" and you're good to go.Read more Helpful Comment Report abuse Afobos5.0 out of 5 stars Great Game!!Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2012Platform: PC DownloadVerified Purchase This is a really great game.
